info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 8 at 8:29PM CDT until April 12 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Red River At Grand Ecore affecting Red River, Grant and Natchitoches Parishes.
Red River At Coushatta affecting Natchitoches, Caddo, Red River, Bienville and Bossier Parishes.
For the Red River...including Dekalb, Index, Fulton, Springbank Ferry, Shreveport, Coushatta, Grand Ecore...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Red River at Grand Ecore.
* WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Friday night.
* IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Minor flooding of lowlands in the Red River floodplain between levees take place.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 31.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 34.0 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.0 feet on 02/22/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 830 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY NIGHT

area.areaDesc: Grant, LA; Natchitoches, LA; Red River, LA
